articles.headline: Yahoo and Verizon Are Said to Be Near a Cheaper Deal
articles.snippet: After the revelations of huge data breaches, the new terms would cut the price for Yahoo’s core internet business by close to $300 million, a person with knowledge of the matter said.
articles.abstract: After the revelations of huge data breaches, the new terms would cut the price for Yahoo’s core internet business by close to $300 million, a person with knowledge of the matter said.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Soon after Yahoo disclosed the first of two enormous data breaches that threatened to upend a $4.8 billion deal it had reached with Verizon Communications, the embattled company began to confront an unpleasant potential future.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Vindu Goel

articles.headline: Trump, Meeting With Netanyahu, Backs Away From Palestinian State
articles.snippet: In talks with Israel’s prime minister, the president said the United States would no longer insist on a two-state solution for a peace accord.
articles.abstract: In talks with Israel’s prime minister, the president said the United States would no longer insist on a two-state solution for a peace accord.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump jettisoned two decades of diplomatic orthodoxy on Wednesday by declaring that the United States would no longer insist on the creation of a Palestinian state as part of a peace accord between Israel and the Palestinians.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Andrew Puzder Withdraws From Consideration as Labor Secretary
articles.snippet: Mr. Puzder, a prominent fast-food executive, faced doubts from several Republican senators amid attacks on his business record and personal life.
articles.abstract: Mr. Puzder, a prominent fast-food executive, faced doubts from several Republican senators amid attacks on his business record and personal life.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The fast-food executive Andrew F. Puzder withdrew his nomination to be labor secretary on Wednesday as Republican senators turned sharply against him, the latest defeat for a White House besieged by infighting and struggling for traction even with a Republican-controlled Congress.

articles.headline: Investors Look Past Headlines as Bull Market Roars Ahead
articles.snippet: Many are choosing to ignore the chaos in Washington and instead are focusing on President Trump’s agenda of tax cuts and deregulation.
articles.abstract: Many are choosing to ignore the chaos in Washington and instead are focusing on President Trump’s agenda of tax cuts and deregulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Markets hate uncertainty. It is one of the oldest saws in finance.

articles.headline: After Election, Trump’s Professed Love for Leaks Quickly Faded
articles.snippet: President Trump once embraced the revealing of Hillary Clinton’s emails. But from the White House, he — like others before him — is calling for an end to government leaks.
articles.abstract: President Trump once embraced the revealing of Hillary Clinton’s emails. But from the White House, he — like others before him — is calling for an end to government leaks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As a candidate for president, Donald J. Trump embraced the hackers who had leaked Hillary Clinton’s emails to the press, declaring at a rally in Pennsylvania, “I love WikiLeaks!”

articles.headline: Asian Conglomerates, Flush With Cash, Scour for U.S. Fund Deals
articles.snippet: American investment firms offer new distribution networks, a better understanding of U.S. markets and access to wealthy investors.
articles.abstract: American investment firms offer new distribution networks, a better understanding of U.S. markets and access to wealthy investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the investment management world these days, the deals are not coming from American or British banks but from big Asian conglomerates flush with cash.

articles.headline: White House Plans to Have Trump Ally Review Intelligence Agencies
articles.snippet: The review is being pushed by President Trump’s chief strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, and would be led by Stephen A. Feinberg, a billionaire private equity executive.
articles.abstract: The review is being pushed by President Trump’s chief strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, and would be led by Stephen A. Feinberg, a billionaire private equity executive.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump plans to assign a New York billionaire to lead a broad review of American intelligence agencies, according to administration officials, an effort that members of the intelligence community fear could curtail their independence and reduce the flow of information that contradicts the president’s worldview.
articles.byline: By James Risen and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: G.O.P.’s Grand Visions for Congress Now Look Like a Mirage
articles.snippet: Congressional Republicans eagerly anticipated securing their conservative agenda, but they have yet to deliver on any of the sweeping legislation they promised.
articles.abstract: Congressional Republicans eagerly anticipated securing their conservative agenda, but they have yet to deliver on any of the sweeping legislation they promised.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congressional Republicans, who craved unified control of the government to secure their aggressive conservative agenda, have instead found themselves on a legislative elliptical trainer, gliding toward nowhere.

articles.headline: Fake News, Fake Ukrainians: How a Group of Russians Tilted a Dutch Vote
articles.snippet: With Europe facing critical elections, fears of Russian meddling are high. Many officials say the first test comes in March in the Netherlands.
articles.abstract: With Europe facing critical elections, fears of Russian meddling are high. Many officials say the first test comes in March in the Netherlands.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE — Harry van Bommel, a left-wing member of the Dutch Parliament, had persuasive allies in convincing voters that they should reject a trade pact with Ukraine — his special “Ukrainian team,” a gleefully contrarian group of émigrés whose sympathies lay with Russia.

articles.headline: A Bee Mogul Confronts the Crisis in His Field
articles.snippet: Beekeeping on an industrial scale is central to American agriculture, and “colony collapse” has proved to be a severe test.
articles.abstract: Beekeeping on an industrial scale is central to American agriculture, and “colony collapse” has proved to be a severe test.
articles.lead_paragraph: KERN COUNTY, Calif. — A soft light was just beginning to outline the Tejon Hills as Bret Adee counted rows of wizened almond trees under his breath.
